descriptions.title: An Overview of the All-Creating King Cycle
descriptions.content: The central text of this cycle is The All-Creating King. It has three associated texts that in some ways form a single whole: a transitional section (skabs sbyor); a supplement (phyi ma); and a secondary supplement (phyi ma’i phyi ma). There is then a series of directly connected texts called the Ten Discourses (mdo bcu) consisting of twelve distinct textual units. Working in the other direction, The All-Creating King incorporates parts of The Eighteen Texts of the Mind Series (sems sde bco brgyad), which in turn are intertextually connected to other Mind Series texts as well.
